text.value: 2. How long have you been in your current position? Years
3. What is your professional background Specify
4. What is your highest level of education?
6. What is your current age in years
If he/she prefer not to answer please write 0
SECTION 2: HEALTH DATA ATTRIBUTES: 7. (a) Data sources: which of the following are the major sources of health data for your routine work and how frequently are used?
i. Routine weekly reports of health care services from health facilities
ii. Routine monthly reports of health care services from health facilities
iii. Administrative record of district offices
in the following format: Data system1 (Rate), Data system2 (Rate), ...
7 (b). If data is obtained from the routine weekly/monthly/quarterly vertical programmes, please mention the programmes
By indicating Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly in brackets eg. PANDORA (Weekly), SUA (Monthly),......

8. Data accessibility and timelines: On the scale shown, kindly indicate how you agree with the statements regarding your accessibility to data ( Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1) ), I prefer not to answer(0)
i. You easily and conveniently access data that you need to make an evidence-based decision
ii. It takes a lot of time to find the required data to make timely decisions
iii. Data is stored in a way that is difficult for you to access
iv. You do not have the capacity to manipulate the DHIS2 to generate data reports
v. Reporting from the healthcare facility level is always on time (according to the set national reporting timelines)
vi. Data corrective actions are always taken within a reasonable time
vii. Data is always available on time for decision making
9. Data storage: Where do you currently keep/store health-related data that you use for your routine work including decision making? (Always (3), Rarely (2), No (1), I prefer not to answer(0))
i. Data is kept in paper report forms
ii. Data is kept in a computer
iii. Data is kept in the server

10. Data accuracy: Please rate your performance on the stated data accuracy domains ( Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1), I prefer not to answer(0))
i. You frequently encounter inaccurate data
ii. Inaccurate data has hindered you from routinely using data to make decisions
iii. You normally take corrective action to address noted data accuracy issues before use
iv. You normally use other data sources and not only routine health data to make decisions

11. Data quality: Please rate the quality of the following data completeness domains ( Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1), I prefer not to answer(0) )
i. The data that you receive includes all the necessary dataset reports
ii. The data that you receive is sufficiently complete and detailed for your needs
iii. The data that you receive is relevant to your current data analysis and aggregation needs
iv. There is limited value due to aggregating inconsistent data
12. Data producers/users interaction: Please, rate your frequency of interactions with data producers on specific activities (Always (3), Rarely (2), No (1), I prefer not to answer(0))
i. What is your frequency of interaction (working together) with data producers (your data sources, e.g. healthcare facility)?
ii. As the data user; do you carry out a joint data analysis and interpretation with data producers?
iii. As the data user; do you carry out a joint discussion regarding data quality with data producers?
iv. As the data user; do you provide feedback to data producers regarding the quality of data?

SECTION 3: DATA ANALYSIS: 13. Data analysis capability: Please rate your capability to conduct the following data analysis activities (Excellent (5), Above average (4), Average (3), Below average (2), Poor (1), I prefer not to answer(0))
i. Technical skill in data capture and organization
ii. Data manipulation, organization and preparation for analysis
iii. Calculation of percentages, frequency or rates correctly
iv. Plotting data by weeks, months or years or by areas
v. Plotting data into bar charts
vii. Technical skills on data presentation and interpretation
viii. Technical skills on report writing
ix. Technical skills on information dissemination
x. Motivation and interests related to data management cycle

14. Analysis processes: Please rate the processes related to conduct data analysis ( Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1), I prefer not to answer(0) )
i. Dashboard/system contains sufficient and readily available analysed data to download and utilize (e.g. charts, tables)?
ii. Analyses generated by the dashboard/system contain sufficient information to monitor trends and patterns
iii. Analyses generated by the dashboard/system is sufficient and sensitive for Early Warning Alert and Response System, i.e. provide immediate alerts on unusual trends or exceeded thresholds
iv. Additional analyses needed to complement automated results from dashboard/system
v. Additional analyses needed to conduct comparison analyses (over time, between facilities, between indicators performance)
vi. Ability to export data for custom analysis
vii. Internet accessibility is strong enough to support access to data repository eg. DHIS2
15. Please, mention the specific programme/software that is used for routine data analysis
16. How do you currently analyse data? (Frequently (3), Occasionally (2), Never (1), I prefer not to answer(0))
ii. Data is analysed using a calculator
iii. Data is analysed using computer software
iv. Data is analysed using DHIS2

17. Data use: On the scale shown, how much do you agree or disagree with the following statement regarding your practices on data use in planning, monitoring, evaluation and decision making in the following categories. You use data (Always (3), Rarely (2), Never (1), I prefer not to answer(0))
v. To monitor the pattern and trend of diseases
vi. For planning, supervision and health promotion
viii. For medical supply and drug management
ix. For setting targets and goals
x. For budget preparation and reallocation
xii. For identification of emerging epidemics
xiv. For informing best practices in health care delivery

18. Data use in planning, monitoring, evaluation and decisions making is most important in which levels of health system (Strongly agree (6), Agree slightly (5), Neither agree nor disagree (4), Disagree slightly (3), Disagree strongly (2), I prefer not to answer(1), I prefer not to answer(0))
19. In your opinion describe the characteristic of the information system you are responsible with in term of the following attributes
20. Kindly indicate how often the following happen (Daily (6), Weekly (5), Monthly (4), Quarterly (3), Annually (2), Never (1), I prefer not to answer(0)
i. Meetings for reviewing managerial or administrative matters?
ii. Do you provide your staff with continuous professional training related to data management cycle
iii. Do you send feedback regarding data analysis outputs to healthcare facilities
iv. Do you seek advice in terms of data management from the higher levels (Regional/National)
21. How often are the following issues related to health data discussed in your routine meetings? (Always (3), Rarely (2), Never (1), I prefer not to answer(0))
iv. Findings from data analysis and interpretation
vii. Data use in decision making & planning
x. Feedback to data generators (health facilities)
22. Are plans/guidelines for data analysis exist?
What would you comment on their usefulness
probe on the frequency of use and associated challenges including training, the complexity of the plan/guidelines, language e.t.c

23. Please indicate how you agree or disagree with the following statements. The introduction of computerized health management information system has strengthened: (Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1), I prefer not to answer(0))
24 a) Do you have a copy of the National Guidelines for Integrated Disease Surveillance and Response 2011?
25. Have you received any training related to IDSR during the past 12 months? (probe when, what topics, and who provided the training)
26. (i) Are you involved in healthcare facility supervision visits?
(ii) Do these supervision visits cover facility performance related to integrated disease surveillance and response?
(iii) What aspects are covered? (probe for: IDSR reporting performance? HMIS/DHIS2 issues? Laboratory issues? Antimicrobial use and resistance issues?)
27. What are you expected to do if a facility did not heed your previous recommendations or follow certain guidelines/protocols? What have you done in the past?

28. Do you receive supervision from the Regional Health Management Team (RHMT) regularly? In reality, how often have they come in the 12 months? Do these visits cover issues related to IDSR/MTUHA/DHIS2? (Probe for which issues).
29. Do you find the RHMT supervisory visits helpful? How have they helped you? (Give examples). What would you find most helpful in a supervisory visit from the RHMT?
30. Is there a specific budget item for data management for the district?
